page.title: 04WORK IN WEST LEOMINSTER
page.content: Employment in this area is almost solely connected with agriculture, with the exception of a small food processing plant and a small structural steel fabrication unit producing mainly agricultural buildings. There is a high level of casual, seasonal work connected with hop-planting and picking, fruit picking and potato harvesting. This labour was traditionally supplied by travelling gipsies, but although there are still some of these travelling families to be found, students and housewives now provide the greater part of the seasonal labour force. Those not employed in agriculture have to travel either to Leominster or Hereford to find employment. Unemployment is high and wages are generally low.
